thread.title: IPL Auction 2017: In a historic first, Afghanistan players Mohammad Nabi and Rashid Khan get IPL contracts of Rs 30 lakhs and Rs 4 Crore respectively
thread.title_full: IPL Auction 2017: In a historic first, Afghanistan players Mohammad Nabi and Rashid Khan get IPL contracts of Rs 30 lakhs and Rs 4 Crore respectively

author: FE Online
title: IPL Auction 2017: In a historic first, Afghanistan players Mohammad Nabi and Rashid Khan get IPL contracts of Rs 30 lakhs and Rs 4 Crore respectively
text:
Sports IPL Auction 2017: In a historic first, Afghanistan players Mohammad Nabi and Rashid Khan get IPL contracts of Rs 30 lakhs and Rs 4 Crore respectively IPL Auction 2017: In a historic first, Afghanistan players Mohammad Nabi and Rashid Khan get IPL contracts of Rs 30 lakhs and Rs 4 Crore respectively IPL Auction 2017: In a historic moment in the ongoing IPL Player Auction 2017, Mohammad Nabi became the first player from his country to be picked by a franchise. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 20, 2017 1:25 PM IPL Auction 2017: Mohammad Nabi became the first player from his country to be picked by a franchise. (Source: Reuters) 
IPL Auction 2017: In a historic moment in the ongoing IPL Player Auction 2017, Mohammad Nabi became the first player from his country to be picked by a franchise. He picked by Sunrisers Hyderabad for Rs. 30 lakhs. Moments later his teammate, Rashid Khan was signed by Mumbai Indians for a whopping amount of Rs. 4 Crores. 
(story under development
